RTCRtpTransceiverStopped.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The read-only stopped property
on the interface indicates whether or not the
transceiver's associated sender and receiver have both been stopped.

remarks.para:
The transceiver is stopped if the
method has been called or if a change to either the local or the remote description has
caused the transceiver to be stopped for some reason.

blockquote.para:
Note: This property is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Instead, look
at the value of .
Its value is stopped if the transceiver has stopped.

remarks.para:
-WebRTC API
-Introduction to the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP)

RTCRtpTransceiverStopped.value:
A Boolean value which is true if the transceiver's
will no longer send data, and its
will no longer receive data. If
either or both are still at work, the result is false.
